title: Firefox download-manager saves status code 204/404 response body to local download folder
content:
I am not sure whether I can post one issue related with programming, I think it is better to report it bugzilla for FF, but it seems not to be available now According to the below information, I knew FF can work well for the download from WebPage

  • Why isn't it possible to download a file for status code 4XX and 5XX
  • File-not-found HTML downloaded as .exe from members.aol.com

But in FF download manager, the behavior is different, when cancelling the download, and remove it from server side, and then select retry, it still downloads the response body as a binary file, here is the reproduce steps:

1. Preparing a big zip file, for example, photos.zip, 20MB 2. Put it to http server side, and write a simple download web page Download a zip file 3. Download it with FF, and then cancel it before the download is finished 4. Remove this file from http server 5. In FF download manager, select the cancel download, and retry or restore the download 6. It will download the below response body, and save the below 404 page as "photos.zip" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">

<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html;charset=utf-8"> <title>Error response</title>

Error response

Error code: 404

Message: File not found.

Error code explanation: HTTPStatus.NOT_FOUND - Nothing matches the given URI.

It is very confused, and let end-user misunderstand that the original file is already downloaded successfully. I also try to modify server response content-type to "application/octet-stream", content-length to "0" or "-1", all does not work even save a photos.zip with zero size. In the download manager of other browsers, for example, Chrome, it does not save anything to local download folder if the status code is 204/4xx/5xx. So, my question is: How to let FF not to save anything to local download folder for the download URL which response with 204/4XX/5XX, keep the same behavior with download from webpage?
creator: wangf1978

title: Unable to access all of CBA netbank website
content:
I have the latest version of Firefox (107.0.1) I can access the CBA Netbank website but when I try to access upcoming payments I finally get the message that the page cannot be displayed due to a technical error. I have spoken to the Netbank help and the problem is not fixed.

Yet when I logon to MS Edge I am able to access all of the Netbank website.

This is the only website that I have this problem with.
creator: nomadslife47

title: Firefox keeps crashing upon startup (in safe mode; after reinstallation)
content:
Firefox often crashes when I start it. I have tried reinstalling firefox clean (also removing the profile folder). The crashes also happen in troubleshooting mode. After several reopening/crashes, Firefox may be successfully opened (even in normal mode).

It's the latest Firefox. I am on Windows 11 22H2. NVidia driver also just updated to latest.

Some submitted crash reports: bp-b1d488c1-66a3-4068-9b07-6f5490221213 & bp-b872a4e0-28d2-4491-889c-0e65e0221213

Cheers
creator: tttins
